title: Create new /products browsing page from Figma design
description: Implement a new dedicated /products page that allows users to browse and filter OSH (Open Source Hardware) designs with advanced filtering capabilities, stats display, and improved UI based on the DTEC Figma prototype

title: Create /pages/products.tsx route with basic layout
description: Create the main products page route at /pages/products.tsx. Set up basic Next.js page structure with SSR translations, layout wrapper, and container divs. Reference existing /pages/projects.tsx as a starting point but adapt for the new design.

title: Add i18n translations for products page
description: Create translation keys in public/locales/en/ for all new strings: 'Browse OSH Designs', filter labels, stat labels, etc. Add to appropriate namespace (createProjectProps or new productsProps). Ensure all hardcoded strings are using t() function.

title: Apply Figma design tokens and styling
description: Apply design system from Figma: IBM Plex Sans font family, Space Grotesk for headings, color tokens (Primary #036A53, Highlight #F1BD4D, Surface #FFFFFF, Warning #F1BD4D, Borders/Subdued #C9CCCF). Use Shadow/sm for cards. Ensure consistent spacing and typography throughout.

title: Add loading states and error handling
description: Implement skeleton loaders for product cards during data fetch. Add error states with retry functionality. Handle empty states with helpful messaging when no products match filters. Use existing EmptyState component where applicable.

title: Test products page functionality and accessibility
description: Write tests for filter interactions, search, sorting, pagination. Test keyboard navigation and screen reader support. Verify all filters work correctly in combination. Check performance with large datasets.

title: Implement header section with title, description and stats
description: Create header component showing 'Browse OSH Designs' title, subtitle description, and three stat cards (Total Projects: 18429, Projects available: 2847, Manufacturers: 512). Use Figma design tokens: Head/H1 font, Primary color #036A53, Surface #FFFFFF. Stats should be fetched from GraphQL or calculated from data.

title: Build enhanced left sidebar filter component
description: Create comprehensive ProductsFilters component with collapsible sections for: Manufacturability (3 options), Machines Needed (checkboxes), Materials Needed (checkboxes), Location (search), Categories & Tags (search/select), Power Compatibility, Power Requirement, Replicability. Each filter should update URL query params and trigger data refetch.

title: Create product card grid component
description: Build ProductCardGrid component displaying products in responsive grid layout. Each card shows: product image, title, description, badges (Can be Manufactured, etc), machine icons, license info, and like count. Use Shadow/sm for card elevation. Support hover states.

title: Implement search bar with filters integration
description: Add search functionality at the top of the main content area. Should search across project names, descriptions, and tags. Integrate with existing SearchBar component but customize for products filtering. Update URL query params and trigger filtered results.

title: Add Sort by and Show controls
description: Implement sorting dropdown (Latest, Oldest, Most Liked, etc) and 'Show All' selector. Position in top-right of content area. Sorting should update query params and re-fetch data accordingly.

title: Implement GraphQL query for products filtering
description: Create or extend GraphQL query to support all new filter parameters: manufacturability, machines, materials, location, tags, power specs, replicability. Should return paginated results with total counts for stats display.

title: Add pagination controls and infinite scroll
description: Implement pagination at bottom of product grid. Show results count (e.g., 'Showing 8 results'). Consider infinite scroll or Load More button. Should work with GraphQL cursor-based pagination.

title: Make layout responsive for mobile and tablet
description: Ensure the products page works on all screen sizes. Sidebar filters should collapse to drawer/modal on mobile. Product grid should adapt from 3 columns (desktop) to 2 (tablet) to 1 (mobile). Test on various breakpoints.
